title: East & Northeast India
hero_image_alt: Tea gardens of Darjeeling and monasteries of Sikkim
subtitle: Himalayas, Tribal Hills & Living Traditions
intro: East and Northeast India offer a stunning contrast between the cultural depth of Bengal and Odisha and the untouched beauty of the Seven Sisters. From the colonial heritage of Kolkata and the sun temples of Konark to the mist-covered peaks of Sikkim and the vibrant tribal hills of Mizoram, this region rewards the traveler with diverse landscapes, unique cuisines, and warm hospitality.

best_time.notes: Winter is perfect for Kolkata and Odisha; Summer (Mar-May) is ideal for Sikkim and Northeast hill stations.

top_experiences.title: Himalayan Monasteries
top_experiences.summary: Explore ancient Buddhist monasteries in Sikkim and Darjeeling (Rumtek, Pemayangtse).

top_experiences.title: Tribal Heritage of Northeast
top_experiences.summary: Experience the unique Mizo culture, festivals like Chapchar Kut, and village life.

top_experiences.title: Temple Circuits & Rituals
top_experiences.summary: Jagannath Puri Rath Yatra and Konark Sun Temple architectural marvels.

top_experiences.title: Tea Gardens & Toy Trains
top_experiences.summary: Stay in colonial tea estates in Darjeeling and Assam.

top_experiences.title: Mangroves & Tigers
top_experiences.summary: Boat safaris in the world's largest mangrove delta.

top_cities.title: Kolkata
top_cities.summary: Cultural capital with colonial architecture, literary life and festivals.
top_cities.how_to_reach_snippet: Nearest airport: Kolkata (CCU) / Rail: Howrah Junction

top_cities.title: Sikkim (Gangtok)
top_cities.summary: Himalayan state with views of Kanchenjunga, orchids, and serene monasteries.

top_cities.title: Darjeeling
top_cities.summary: Queen of Hills known for world-famous tea and the UNESCO Heritage Toy Train.
top_cities.how_to_reach_snippet: Nearest airport: Bagdogra (IXB) / Rail: New Jalpaiguri (NJP)

top_cities.title: Mizoram (Aizawl)
top_cities.summary: Land of the Blue Mountains, vibrant bamboo dances, and high-altitude ridges.
top_cities.how_to_reach_snippet: Nearest airport: Lengpui (AJL) / scenic roads from Silchar

top_cities.title: Puri
top_cities.summary: Coastal spiritual hub, home to the Jagannath Temple and golden beaches.
top_cities.how_to_reach_snippet: Nearest airport: Bhubaneswar (BBI) / Rail: Puri Station

top_cities.title: Imphal
top_cities.summary: Historic valley city, gateway to Loktak Lake and Keibul Lamjao National Park.

cuisine_highlights.name: Mizo Bai & Vawksa Rep
cuisine_highlights.note: Herbal stews and smoked pork delicacies

travel_tips: Inner Line Permits (ILP) are required for Mizoram and parts of Sikkim for domestic/international tourists.
Pack heavy woolens for Sikkim in winter; light cottons for Kolkata year-round.
Roads in the Northeast can be unpredictable during monsoon; plan buffers.
Carry cash when traveling to remote hill districts in Mizoram and Sikkim.

sample_itineraries.1-day: Gangtok essence: Rumtek Monastery morning, MG Marg stroll, and cable car ride for Kanchenjunga views.
sample_itineraries.5-day: Northeast Hills: Aizawl cultural tour, Reiek Peak trek, transfer to Silchar/Imphal for Loktak Lake.

logistics.typical_internal_transport: Shared sumos/jeeps are the lifeline in Sikkim and Mizoram; Trains for Bengal/Odisha plains.
logistics.notes: Check current permit regulations online before booking flights to Northeast states.
